CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 12, 1945, pg. 13 reads: "Gold and Blue - There are gold and blue stars in window of the home of Mrs. Pocohontas Patterson of Kedron Street, for the mother pictured here has lost one son in the European war, and has another in the Pacific. Sgt. Edgar Patterson was killed in Tunisia in September, 1943.  Her other son, Sgt. Junius Patterson, has been in the South Pacific since early in the war. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gold Star mother Pocohontas or Pocahontas Patterson, seated on patterned sofa, possibly in home on Kedron Street
